content: Let's use this stream for Connectathon discussions on the Workflow Track
Our WIki Page: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=201605_Workflow#Workflow
hi
works!
which server will we use?
http://fhir3.healthintersections.com.au/
Guys we have a Patient, Mr Bob Workflow, he is found here: http://fhir3.healthintersections.com.au/open/Patient/468
And if you need a Practitioner then maybe use Penny Puffer found here: http://fhir3.healthintersections.com.au/open/Practitioner/50

now there is a careplan here http://nprogram.azurewebsites.net/CarePlan/1

and CarePlan/2 is linked to Patient/468 Bob Workflow
http://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=9963

Hello workflow-experts,

so we (@Karl Holzer and I) are planning to play around a little with the workflow resources and the Workflow Communication Patterns (https://hl7-fhir.github.io/workflow.html#commpatterns) at the Baltimore Connectathon. We know there is no workflow track, but since we want to try out the ideas discussed in the FHIR-Workflow-Calls we would like to test it.

Our initial question would be if anybody is interested in participating, and if you have a preferred option (Request-Event, or Request-Task)? We gravitate either towards option C or option H. In any case I am planning to play 3rd party intermediary during the connectathon, but am happy to play placer|fullfiller if anyone else wants to implement the intermediary.

Please let us know if you are interested in connectathoning with us.

Best,
Oliver

And hello again workflow-experts,

new WGM new try, since people have shown interest in the Patterns on Zulip now. In the Monday-Workflow call we discussed the possibility of doing a hackathon-track at one of the upcoming WGM CATs, specifically concerning the Request-Event pattern (http://build.fhir.org/workflow.html) and with that the communication patterns (http://build.fhir.org/workflow.html#commpatterns). What I would like to know from you is, if you are interested in testing those patterns, and which ones you need for your use-cases.

From the talks yesterday I gathered that use cases from the medication or laboratory domain would be prominent. So right now I am thinking about a Pharmacy MedicationRequest Use Case but am open to suggestions or additional requirements/use cases from other domains.

If you have any interest in contributing to a potential track (SanAntonio or any other upcoming WGM) please let us know, even if you canâ€™t commit resources (yet). The first step is just to see if we do have a need for a track. So just drop a reply here, or drop me a mail.
Such a track would definitely be interesting to try out and get familiar with the workflow resources.
@Claude Nanjo is running connectathon streams around communication processes
I totally share @Oliver Krauss point of view and think it's a good idea to set-up a hackacthon track for testing worflow related resources.
@Oliver Krauss I agree, it would be very useful to test the different workflow scenarios and the according resources at the upcoming fhir connectathons
@Grahame Grieve: in which track(s) is that occuring?
not a track. I thought it was last connectathon.. Obviously not
I think they tried last connectathon but there wasn't the interest/participation. I don't see anything scheduled for San Antonio.
no
This thread is an attempt to drum up interest in having a track this time.

Hi. exactly that. An attempt to drum up interest and a question to identify need. We need/already use the workflow patterns for our work and wanted to see if anyone else is using them and willing to test on any upcoming Connecthaton.

@Paul Knapp we were 2 people/organizations at the last connecthaton. Back then the Attachments track used some of the ressources and we ended up joining them.
@Oliver Krauss Good! Will you be joining the Attachments track again at the SAn Antonio Connectathon?
@Paul Knapp Yes. Looking through the track proposals this is a good fit just as it was in Baltimore. See you Saturday
